metadata.dc:description: Psittacosis is an uncommon cause of acute pericarditis and pericardial effusion. However, some isolated cases have been reported. We present a case which the first clinical feature of psittacosis was acute pericarditis. Severe pericardial effusion associated with a pulmonary infiltrate and an epidemiologic history of contact with avian species suggested the diagnosis of psittacosis, confirmed by serological test.
metadata.dc:title: Pericarditis aguda con derrame como forma de presentación de psitacosis.
[Acute pericarditis with effusion as a form of presentation of psittacosis].
